confession.devil_appearance: hideous figure in black, with claws
confession.seduction_context: Her daughter Marguitte was lost one night when looking for animals. Husband returned from St Dié saying he heard a girl had been eaten by animals, leaving only her head. In despair, Percin appeared and promised to find her daughter if she would give herself to him. He found the girl sleeping under a bush.

testimony.quarrel_subject: lawsuit with her husband about a discharge of water which latter wanted him to allow in his garden
testimony.threat_quote: Thousse que tu puisse crever bien tost apres les aultres

testimony.quarrel_subject: father was collecting tithes, and husband of accused was caught evading them

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: languished for a year before dying

testimony.quarrel_subject: his son quarreled with accused's son, whom he found pasturing animals in their field

testimony.threat_quote: they would be dear ecus for him

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claude Tendon had encroached on his land
wanted to work in an old room in her house, under terms of his patent from duke
she found his geese and pig in her meadow
witness refused to eat milk from accused's house

harms_alleged.target: son (illness moved around from head to arms and legs, lasted 4 years)

testimony.quarrel_subject: lawsuit with her husband over a meadow, which witness won

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: First interrogation; partial confession (devil appeared 2 years earlier)

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Procureur asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Interrogation under threat of torture; full confession (seduction 30 years earlier when daughter was lost)

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; lightly racked; confessed to killing three people and many animals

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Final interrogation; discharged some accomplices, confirmed accusations against husband and others

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Procureur for chapter asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Claude Tendon
accomplices_named.context: Husband; said to be a perfect witch, seduced 16-17 years before over storm that scattered oats, attended sabbat together 3 times

accomplices_named.name: Marguitte femme Jean Bonipaire
accomplices_named.context: Daughter; persuaded by mother to attend sabbat 3 years earlier, initially refused to renounce God but mother persuaded her (later discharged)

accomplices_named.name: Jean Babey
accomplices_named.context: Danced with accused at first sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Colatte Villon
accomplices_named.context: Seen at second sabbat on Cambas

accomplices_named.name: Didier Vincent
accomplices_named.context: Seen at second sabbat on Cambas

accomplices_named.name: Jean Claude Colin
accomplices_named.context: Seen at second sabbat; accused's brother

accomplices_named.name: daughter of la Malraymatte
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; her mother had been burned

accomplices_named.name: Demenge de la Leaue
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; man with no children

accomplices_named.name: widow of Claude Colnot
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice; already under arrest

accomplices_named.name: Mathieu Blaise
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; old man with grey beard

prior_accusations.context: Said she was a witch but husband Claude Tendon was not; George himself was arrested and burned as a witch a few days later

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
notable_quotes.french: Thousse que tu puisse crever bien tost apres les aultres
notable_quotes.english: Cough so that you may die very soon after the others
notable_quotes.context: Said to Jean Colynot about his coughing cow

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
notable_quotes.context: Words spoken to fly to sabbat on greased broom

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Claude Tendon
notable_quotes.french: ce fut bien malgré elle et n'estoit d'ung bon coeur
notable_quotes.english: it was very much against her will and was not with a good heart
notable_quotes.context: Describing her renunciation of God and acceptance of powder

relationships.evidence_text: married to Claude Tendon for some 40 years
her daughter Marguitte, now married to Jean Bonipaire of Chanoy
Jean Claude Colin of Fouchifol, whom she had named, was her brother
same story as sister about father
had lived with her father, le maire Claude Aulbry
Colas Grand Didier, de Mandray; Same story as wife
Claude Tendon had encroached on his land

heard accused curse the cow
quarrel between husbands

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused said mother not feeding child well, should avoid black soups

harms_catalog.harm_description: various losses of cattle with strange illnesses

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: child sent with dried pears, accused gave her bread and cheese
son had quarrel with accused's son about pasturing animals
dispute over fruit trees; witness said he would pay 2 ecus to have witches burned

land encroachment
land encroachment

harms_catalog.harm_description: great thunderstorm which damaged oats; accused's fields virtually unaffected while others scattered
goat sickened and died in a day as if rabid
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel; witness called her witch and she replied with threats
another quarrel
she found his geese and pig in her meadow; said she would get even in another way

harms_catalog.harm_description: goat found eating her hedge; animal died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: goat eating her hedge; she wished it to devil

harms_catalog.harm_description: calf would not suck and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused remarked that cow would soon calve

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness refused to eat milk from accused's house; accused was told one of her sons said this

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost so many animals they were almost in poverty
parents and brothers and sisters all died

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: lawsuit with her husband over a meadow, which witness won
his pigs damaged her garden and he called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: Claudatte fille Dieudonné le maire d'Aulbripaire
harms_catalog.harm_description: hurt toe on stick, infection spread, died miserably in 6 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to help when cartload of wood was bogged down
harms_catalog.method_alleged: stick placed in river by instruction of devil

harms_catalog.harm_description: developed bad knee, died in a month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: angry with nearest neighbour

harms_catalog.harm_description: hurt foot on stick in field

Various references: cow losing milk, breast milk loss, refusing milk from accused's house
Accused told mother to avoid feeding these to baby
Worn by woman who danced first with devil at sabbat

weather_events: great thunderstorm 18 years before that damaged oats
making hail at sabbat (though did not do much harm)
economic_hardship_indicators: lost so many animals they were almost in poverty
father said he was ruined and had nothing more to lose
economic value of animals mentioned frequently (100 ecus, 7 ecus foal, etc.)
concern about property confiscation leaving children poor
religious_calendar_references: between All Saints and Candlemas (period of animal losses)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Lawsuit with Jean Colynot's husband about discharge of water in garden (15 years earlier)
Lawsuit with Dieudonné Colas Grand Didier over a meadow (15 years earlier)
Claude Tendon encroached on Claude Mongeat's land, had to make satisfaction (2 years earlier)
Accused's son imprisoned at St Dié for making cousin pregnant and being a 'sodomiste' (2 years earlier)
Witness obtained reparation for various insults from Mengeatte's daughter

legal_context.redress_outcome: Never sought reparation despite being called witch multiple times publicly

hearsay_chains.content: that she was very angry about the case, uttering various threats

emotional_state_notes: was weeping in her garden when devil first appeared
in despair when daughter was lost
said she had not slept a quarter of an hour all night, praying
particularly sorry for husband and daughter
regretted children would be poor due to confiscation

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said losses of Jean Colnot had been caused by Jean Babey, not her (told this was untrue)

third_parties.name: Jean Babey
third_parties.context: Accused initially claimed he confessed to harming Jean Colnot's animals; also seen dancing with accused at sabbat

third_parties.name: Jean du Ban
third_parties.context: Accused confessed to killing his cow with powder; described as 'the late Jean du Ban'

third_parties.name: George de Hault
third_parties.context: Said Mongeatte was a witch but husband Claude Tendon was not; arrested and burned a few days later

third_parties.name: curé
third_parties.context: Blessed the house of Claude Aulbry at accused's suggestion

third_parties.name: la Malraymatte
third_parties.context: Already burned; her daughter seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: Percin
third_parties.context: Devil/master; appeared as hideous figure in black with claws; seduced accused 30 years earlier

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete extraction from 7-page PDF. Trial shows classic patterns: long reputation (40+ years), property disputes, animal deaths following quarrels, eventual confession under torture threat, sabbat attendance, naming of accomplices. Accused initially confessed to seduction 2 years earlier but under torture threat changed story to 30 years earlier. Notable features include son's imprisonment for sodomy as trigger for devil's approach, payment of black hen to reduce devil's visits, and retraction of accusations against daughter and some others.
